featured.text: 16.(A) rebel (B) to rebel (C) rebelling (D) be rebelled 17.(A)
But it later turned out that it was exactly his courage to “rebel” and to express his own ideas that marks his films with distinct creativity.
As a teenager, Cartier-Bresson rebelled against his parents’ formal ways of education.

definition.zh_def: 反叛者；反抗權威或政府的人
definition.en_def: A person who resists or opposes authority, control, or tradition.
definition.example: The young man decided to rebel against his parents' strict rules.
